info.author: Jatin Goel
info.description:
DB CONNECT
==========

DB Connect is a package for connecting to different types of Databases from Python.

|

DB Connect executes the SQL query on the Database that the user connected to, and
returns an object of the DBResponse class, after parsing through the response
received from the Database, and initializes the attributes of the Response class
with the values from the DB query response.



Requirements
------------

- Python 2.7 or above
- `pymssql <https://pypi.python.org/pypi/pymssql/2.1.3>`_ Python package, for connecting to **Microsoft SQL Server**
- `pymysql <https://pypi.python.org/pypi/PyMySQL>`_ Python package, for connecting to **MySQL** Database
- `pyhdb <https://pypi.python.org/pypi/pyhdb/>`_ Python package, for connecting to **SAP HANA** Database


Installing DB_CONNECT
---------------------

DB_CONNECT is available on GitHub `here <>`_

It can be installed from source. After downloading, from within the ``db_connect`` directory, execute::

    python setup.py install


Uninstalling
------------

You can uninstall using the **pip** command::

	pip uninstall db_connect



Usage
=====

- Create an object of the specific database, you want to connect to. (MSSQL in this case)

    >>> from db_connect import MSSQL
    >>> mssql = MSSQL(server, user, password, database, as_dict, autocommit)


- Executing a query:

    >>> db_response = mssql.execute('SELECT * FROM TABLE_NAME')


- Get list of columns:

    >>> db_response.columns


- Get the SQL Query that was executed:

    >>> db_response.query


- Get the count of rows returned in the response

    >>> db_response.rowcount


- Get the list of rows returned in the response

    >>> db_response.rows


Coding Considerations
=====================

- All python code should be **PEP8** compliant.
- The code should be formatted using **autopep8** with line-length set to **99** instead of default **79**.
- All changes and any new methods/classes should be properly documented.
- The doc strings should be of the same format as existing docs.

Code of Conduct
===============

Everyone interacting in the **DB_CONNECT** project's codebases, issue trackers,
chat rooms, and mailing lists is expected to follow the
`PyPA Code of Conduct`_.

.. _PyPA Code of Conduct: https://www.pypa.io/en/latest/code-of-conduct/
